results.title: Masonry: preparation of plane surfaces
results.brief_description: A demonstration of the method of preparing a plane stone surface by cutting in corners and drafts and finally removing the remainder of the excess stone. A clean face is obtained with the help of sand and york stone and carborundum. From this clean face, adjoining sides can be accurately worked and checked. Tools that are used include the pitching tool, drafting chisel, punch, claw tool and boaster.

results.title: Masonry: moulded work
results.brief_description: An ovolo moulding has been selected as an example. The working of this is demonstrated in detail, zinc template giving the section, cutting the main chamfer, fillets and further chamfers and the use of the boaster to finish the job. The method of working a return end is also shown.

results.title: Masculine or feminine: your role in society
results.creator_credit: J William Walker and Coronet Films
results.brief_description: In live interviews, people with differing backgrounds and attitudes examine “masculine” and “feminine” roles in society during the 1970’s. In the wake of feminism as a social context of the time (1970), this film examines how the explicit boundaries dividing masculinity and femininity have become increasingly blurred. Areas looked at are work, domesticity and marriage.

results.title: Masai in Tanzania
results.brief_description: A look at the famed African warrior tribe, the Masai, noted for their height and lack of Negroid features. The women are viewed going about their household tasks and preparing materials for the building of a new home. The Masai now have peaceful trading relations with neighbouring tribes whereas before, when weapons were carried in the market-place there were bloody battles at trading sites.

results.title: Mary Lewis -Student Nurse
results.brief_description: The story of a young girl’s three years’ training to becomes a States Registered Nurse in London. Follows the student’s life on and off duty, shows the comprehensive training received, and indicates the opportunities in various fields of nursing open to girls who qualify.

results.title: Mary Bignal Rand
results.brief_description: Almost unknown in 1957, Mary Bignal, now Mrs. Rand, gained renown having won every international athletic track events. She was chosen Sportswoman of the Year in 1959, and is one of the finest all round athletes Britain has known. She manages to combine a fulltime job with the rigorous training of a champion and the everyday chores of a housewife.

results.title: Marva
results.creator_credit: Suzanne St Pierre and CBS News
results.brief_description: Marva Collins is a teacher who set up a school in a low income area of Chicago. There are no frills, and students are drilled in vocabulary and multiplication tables, and are required to read one book every two weeks. Many of her students love reading, and Marva is an inspiration to them.
